item.title: Branches overgrown at entrance to station steps, 26th October
item.description:
The tree growing in the cafe garden next to the Newlands Park entrance to Penge East station is overgrown and needs pruning. Branches are at eye height and people are having to duck under them to enter the stairs. Could pose a risk to visually impaired pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive Road Works have been abandoned, 26th October
item.description:
Nothing has been done on these massive roadworks since Tuesday the 21st of October; massive disruption with 4 way control; temporarily lights failed and are not working; it's an absolute chaos and when schools start next week it will be very dangerous for pedestrians as there is only a very narrow corridor left for people and we get a lot of foot traffic along logs hill. Please make those people finish what they started and remove all obstructions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St George's Road West, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
